locations.name: Vaniville Town
locations.description: Blooming buds covered in morning dew exude hope for the future in this small town.

locations.name: Aquacorde Town
locations.description: A town that naturally sprang up as people flocked to this pristine riverside.

locations.name: Santalune City
locations.description: Many beginning Trainers gather in this friendly city to start a Pokémon journey.

locations.name: Lumiose City
locations.description: A dazzling metropolis of art and artifice, located in the very heart of the Kalos region.

locations.name: Camphrier Town
locations.description: This ancient town was once famous for the long-neglected manor home of a noble family.

locations.name: Cyllage City
locations.description: A city nestled between the cliffs and the sea, overlooked by steep Bicycle racecourses.

locations.name: Ambrette Town
locations.description: This town was known only for its aquarium until the discovery of rare Fossils really put it on the map.

locations.name: Geosenge Town
locations.description: A town lined with mysterious stones and encircled by strange ruins of old.

locations.name: Shalour City
locations.description: The seaside home of the Tower of Mastery, where the legend of mysterious stones lives on.

locations.name: Coumarine City
locations.description: An exclusive resort area made popular thanks to its clear skies and mild atmosphere.

locations.name: Laverre City
locations.description: An unearthly city created by those inspired by a mysterious and ancient tree 1,500 years old.

locations.name: Dendemille Town
locations.description: A rural town where Pokémon and windmills work together to farm the land in a chilly latitude.

locations.name: Anistar City
locations.description: Some say the enigmatic device used as a sundial came from outer space.

locations.name: Couriway Town
locations.description: The railway brings people from great distances to see the huge, majestic falls.

locations.name: Snowbelle City
locations.description: They say the cold air flowing from the Pokémon Gym is responsible for this city's frozen state.

locations.name: Pokémon League
locations.description: This path is open only to those who can best every Pokémon Gym in the Kalos region.

locations.name: Kiloude City
locations.description: This city, popular with Pokémon Trainers, is a typical example of southern Kalosian life.

locations.name: Route 1 (Vaniville Pathway)
locations.description: A small and quiet country lane that connects Vaniville Town and Aquacorde Town.

locations.name: Route 2 (Avance Trail)
locations.description: You'll find many Pokémon hiding among the tall grass that grows in tufts along this trail.

locations.name: Route 3 (Ouvert Way)
locations.description: The little rises and hollows of this lush forest are a favorite place for many kinds of Pokémon to play.

locations.name: Route 4 (Parterre Way)
locations.description: This famed path's perfectly designed and executed gardens are its highlight and a special point of pride.

locations.name: Route 5 (Versant Road)
locations.description: Roller Skaters from across the Kalos region gather on this hilly path to demonstrate their best skills.

locations.name: Route 6 (Palais Lane)
locations.description: This tree-lined path was once covered with grass as tall as a man, but it was cleared by the palace.

locations.name: Route 7 (Rivière Walk)
locations.description: The longest single road in the Kalos region runs straight alongside one of its greatest rivers.

locations.name: Route 8 (Muraille Coast)
locations.description: This is a road of great contrasts, from the harsh rock of the cliffs to the soft sands of the beach.

locations.name: Route 9 (Spikes Passage)
locations.description: This rocky passage was created by retired Rhyhorn racers who forged a path where there was none.

locations.name: Route 10 (Menhir Trail)
locations.description: Countless stones line this mysterious path in such numbers and arrays that it seems overwhelming.

locations.name: Route 11 (Miroir Way)
locations.description: One can feel the power of the earth's interior from the crystals that sprout along this mountain path.

locations.name: Route 12 (Fourrage Road)
locations.description: Frolicking Skiddo can be seen and ridden at the Baa de Mer Ranch, located beside the breezy sea.

locations.name: Route 13 (Lumiose Badlands)
locations.description: Since no plants can grow in the red clay of this great plain, it hosts the Power Plant instead.

locations.name: Route 14 (Laverre Nature Trail)
locations.description: The lush trees and boggy swamps of this trail give off an eerie vibe, even in broad daylight.

locations.name: Route 15 (Brun Way)
locations.description: This path has become a popular hangout for the wild and directionless youths of Lumiose City.

locations.name: Route 16 (Mélancolie Path)
locations.description: This rustic path beside the glittering metropolis of Lumiose City is a well-known fishing spot.

locations.name: Route 17 (Mamoswine Road)
locations.description: Due to constant snowstorms and heavy snowfall, humans have no hope of traversing this road on foot.

locations.name: Route 18 (Vallée Étroite Way)
locations.description: This path is best known for its trolley, once used for the coal mine, and the curious Inverse Battle house.

locations.name: Route 19 (Grande Vallée Way)
locations.description: This great valley can now be crossed thanks to its long bridge, built with the help of many Pokémon.

locations.name: Route 20 (Winding Woods)
locations.description: This path was designed to disturb the woods as little as possible, so it twists and turns among the trees.

locations.name: Route 21 (Dernière Way)
locations.description: This is the path of the chosen, designed to hone the stalwart Trainers who dare face the Pokémon League.

locations.name: Route 22 (Détourner Way)
locations.description: This lively path bustles with many Trainers and their Pokémon, all gathered here to train themselves.

locations.name: Santalune Forest
locations.description: The gentle light filtering through this sun-dappled forest makes it a popular spot for nature walks.

locations.name: Chamber of Emptiness
locations.description: A mysterious void. It is said that nothing can exist within it.

locations.name: Parfum Palace
locations.description: A luxurious palace constructed 300 years ago by a king who wished to display his power to all.

locations.name: Battle Chateau
locations.description: A facility where Trainers can earn ranks of nobility by battling other nobles.

locations.name: Berry Fields
locations.description: A small, walled off estate that contains many patches of soil that are perfect for berry planting.

locations.name: Connecting Cave
locations.description: This cave linking Route 7 (Rivière Walk) and Cyllage City is notable for its great hordes of Zubat.

locations.name: Glittering Cave
locations.description: Lose all sense of direction as you wander though this cave, where Luminous Moss glows emerald green.

locations.name: Reflection Cave
locations.description: The sheer faces of these rock walls reflect the images of people and Pokémon like nature's mirror.

locations.name: Tower of Mastery
locations.description: A famous tower on the northern tip of Shalour City, where Trainers go to understand the phenomenon of Mega Evolution.

locations.name: Azure Bay
locations.description: The deep blue ocean off Kalos's coast, where Pokémon from distant lands are said to visit.

locations.name: Sea Spirit's Den
locations.description: A pit in the shallows of Azure Bay thought to have been from an ancient outpouring of energy.

locations.name: Kalos Power Plant
locations.description: An environmentally responsible power plant that generates solar power from space.

locations.name: Poké Ball Factory
locations.description: An expansive factory where every Poké Ball used in the Kalos region is produced.

locations.name: Lost Hotel
locations.description: This once-famous hotel clings to the shade of its former glory after tragedy left it in ruins.

locations.name: Frost Cavern
locations.description: The drifting snow and impenetrable fog make this cavern a place of fantastical illusions.

locations.name: Lysandre Labs
locations.description: Access to this hidden lab for Team Flare was found behind a china cabinet in Lysandre Café.

locations.name: Team Flare Secret HQ
locations.description: The base of Team Flare's operations, built in secret to activate the ultimate weapon.

locations.name: Terminus Cave
locations.description: A coal mine that was closed a few years ago due to rumors of a monster living deep within it.

locations.name: Pokémon Village
locations.description: Legends say a place exists where Pokémon live in hiding, but no one has ever found it.

locations.name: Victory Road
locations.description: This treacherous path to the Pokémon League will break the hearts of even the toughest Trainers.

locations.name: Unknown Dungeon
locations.description: A very small cave deep inside the Pokémon Village. There doesn't appear to be anything of interest here.
